batch.name: Counting Type Batch 1 — Class 11-12 NEET Biology

questions.question:
How many of the following animals are cold-blooded (poikilotherms)?
Frog, Crocodile, Pigeon, Shark, Lizard, Whale, Salamander, Turtle
questions.explanation: Cold-blooded animals: Frog (amphibian), Crocodile (reptile), Shark (fish), Lizard (reptile), Salamander (amphibian), Turtle (reptile) = 6. Pigeon (bird) and Whale (mammal) are warm-blooded homeotherms. Count = 6. NCERT Ch 4, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following phyla show true coelom (are coelomates)?
Porifera, Annelida, Arthropoda, Mollusca, Echinodermata, Platyhelminthes, Chordata
questions.explanation: True coelomates: Annelida, Arthropoda, Mollusca, Echinodermata, Chordata = 5. Porifera has no body cavity. Platyhelminthes are acoelomates. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 4, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following features are characteristic of phylum Chordata as per NCERT?
(i) Notochord present at some stage
(ii) Dorsal hollow nerve cord
(iii) Ventral heart
(iv) Pharyngeal gill slits present at some stage
(v) Post-anal tail present at some stage
(vi) Open circulatory system
(vii) Bilateral symmetry
questions.explanation: Characteristic features of Chordata: (i) Notochord — Yes. (ii) Dorsal hollow nerve cord — Yes. (iii) Ventral heart — Yes. (iv) Pharyngeal gill slits — Yes. (v) Post-anal tail — Yes. These are the 5 defining features. (vi) Open circulatory system — No. (vii) Bilateral symmetry is shared with non-chordates. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 4, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following animals exhibit radial symmetry?
Hydra, Starfish (adult), Planaria, Sea anemone, Jellyfish, Earthworm
questions.explanation: Radially symmetrical: Hydra (cnidarian), Starfish adult (echinoderm — radially symmetrical per NCERT), Sea anemone (cnidarian), Jellyfish (cnidarian) = 4. Planaria (bilateral) and Earthworm (bilateral) are not. Count = 4. NCERT Ch 4, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following animals belong to phylum Mollusca?
Pila (Apple snail), Octopus, Laccifer, Pinctada (Pearl oyster), Sepia (Cuttlefish), Aplysia (Sea hare), Limulus
questions.explanation: Molluscs: Pila (gastropod), Octopus (cephalopod), Pinctada (bivalve), Sepia (cephalopod), Aplysia (gastropod) = 5. Laccifer (lac insect — Arthropoda) and Limulus (horseshoe crab — Arthropoda) are not. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 4, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following are characteristics of gymnosperms?
(i) Naked seeds not enclosed in fruits
(ii) Presence of vessels in xylem
(iii) Haploid endosperm
(iv) Archegonia present
(v) Microsporangia and megasporangia always on same plant
(vi) Mycorrhizal roots in Pinus
(vii) Needle-like leaves in all genera
questions.explanation: (i) Naked seeds — Yes. (ii) Vessels — No (absent except Gnetales). (iii) Haploid endosperm — Yes. (iv) Archegonia — Yes. (v) Same plant always — No (Cycas is dioecious). (vi) Mycorrhiza in Pinus — Yes. (vii) Needle-like in all — No (Cycas has pinnate leaves). Count = 4 (i, iii, iv, vi). NCERT Ch 3, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following plants belong to division Pteridophyta?
Selaginella, Salvinia, Funaria, Equisetum, Marchantia, Adiantum, Dryopteris, Polytrichum
questions.explanation: Pteridophytes: Selaginella, Salvinia, Equisetum, Adiantum, Dryopteris = 5. Bryophytes (not pteridophytes): Funaria (moss), Marchantia (liverwort), Polytrichum (moss). Count = 5. NCERT Ch 3, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following show oogamous type of sexual reproduction?
Spirogyra, Fucus, Volvox, Chlamydomonas, Sargassum, Polysiphonia
questions.explanation: Oogamous (large non-motile egg + small motile/non-motile sperm): Fucus, Volvox, Sargassum, Polysiphonia = 4. Spirogyra (isogamous/conjugation) and Chlamydomonas (isogamous to anisogamous) are not oogamous. Count = 4. NCERT Ch 3, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following features are found in bryophytes?
(i) Dominant gametophytic phase
(ii) Presence of true roots
(iii) Vascular tissue absent
(iv) Called amphibians of plant kingdom
(v) Sporophyte dependent on gametophyte
(vi) Elaters present in all bryophytes
(vii) Multicellular sex organs with sterile jacket
questions.explanation: (i) Dominant gametophyte — Yes. (ii) True roots — No (rhizoids). (iii) Vascular tissue absent — Yes. (iv) Amphibians of plant kingdom — Yes. (v) Sporophyte on gametophyte — Yes. (vi) Elaters in all — No (only liverworts). (vii) Sterile jacket sex organs — Yes. Count = 5 (i, iii, iv, v, vii). NCERT Ch 3, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following organisms belong to Kingdom Protista?
Amoeba, Paramoecium, Plasmodium, Euglena, Mucor, Trypanosoma, Penicillium
questions.explanation: Kingdom Protista: Amoeba, Paramoecium, Plasmodium, Euglena, Trypanosoma = 5. Mucor (Fungi) and Penicillium (Fungi) are not protists. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 2, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following statements about Kingdom Fungi are correct?
(i) Cell wall is made of chitin
(ii) They store food as glycogen
(iii) All fungi are heterotrophic
(iv) Yeast is a unicellular fungus
(v) Fungi reproduce only by asexual means
(vi) Phycomycetes have aseptate and coenocytic mycelium
(vii) Deuteromycetes are called imperfect fungi
questions.explanation: (i) Chitin cell wall — Yes. (ii) Store glycogen — Yes. (iii) All heterotrophic — Yes. (iv) Yeast unicellular — Yes. (v) Only asexual — No. (vi) Phycomycetes aseptate coenocytic — Yes. (vii) Deuteromycetes imperfect — Yes. Count = 6. NCERT Ch 2, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following are viral diseases?
AIDS, Cholera, Mumps, Influenza, Typhoid, Common cold, Rabies, Ringworm
questions.explanation: Viral: AIDS (HIV), Mumps (paramyxovirus), Influenza, Common cold (rhinovirus), Rabies (rhabdovirus) = 5. Cholera (bacterial), Typhoid (bacterial), Ringworm (fungal) are not viral. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 2, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following are essential amino acids in humans?
Valine, Glycine, Leucine, Alanine, Isoleucine, Tryptophan, Glutamic acid, Lysine
questions.explanation: Essential amino acids from the list: Valine, Leucine, Isoleucine, Tryptophan, Lysine = 5. Non-essential: Glycine, Alanine, Glutamic acid. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 9, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following are polysaccharides?
Starch, Sucrose, Cellulose, Glycogen, Maltose, Chitin, Inulin, Lactose
questions.explanation: Polysaccharides: Starch, Cellulose, Glycogen, Chitin, Inulin = 5. Disaccharides: Sucrose, Maltose, Lactose. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 9, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following are cofactors or coenzymes of enzymes?
NAD+, Zn2+, FAD, Mg2+, Co-A, Mn2+
questions.explanation: All six are cofactors/coenzymes: NAD+ (coenzyme), Zn2+ (cofactor), FAD (coenzyme), Mg2+ (cofactor), Co-A (coenzyme), Mn2+ (cofactor) = 6. Count = 6. NCERT Ch 9, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following organelles are membrane-bound?
Ribosomes, Mitochondria, Golgi apparatus, Centrioles, Lysosomes, Endoplasmic reticulum, Peroxisomes
questions.explanation: Membrane-bound: Mitochondria, Golgi apparatus, Lysosomes, ER, Peroxisomes = 5. Non-membrane-bound: Ribosomes, Centrioles. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 8, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following are found in both prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells?
Cell membrane, Ribosomes, Nucleus, Cell wall, DNA, Endoplasmic reticulum, Cytoplasm
questions.explanation: Found in both: Cell membrane, Ribosomes, DNA, Cytoplasm = 4. Nucleus (absent in prokaryotes), Cell wall (absent in animal cells), ER (absent in prokaryotes). Count = 4. NCERT Ch 8, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following organelles contain their own DNA?
Mitochondria, Chloroplast, Golgi apparatus, Ribosome, Lysosome, Centriole
questions.explanation: Organelles with own DNA: Mitochondria and Chloroplast = 2. These are semi-autonomous organelles. Count = 2. NCERT Ch 8, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following are modifications of stem?
Potato tuber, Ginger rhizome, Onion bulb, Sweet potato, Garlic bulb, Colocasia corm, Carrot
questions.explanation: Stem modifications: Potato tuber, Ginger rhizome, Onion bulb, Garlic bulb, Colocasia corm = 5. Root modifications: Sweet potato (tuberous root), Carrot (taproot). Count = 5. NCERT Ch 5, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following plants have hypogynous flowers (superior ovary)?
Mustard, Sunflower, China rose, Brinjal, Cucumber, Petunia
questions.explanation: Hypogynous: Mustard (Brassicaceae), China rose (Malvaceae), Brinjal (Solanaceae), Petunia (Solanaceae) = 4. Epigynous: Sunflower (Asteraceae), Cucumber (Cucurbitaceae). Count = 4. NCERT Ch 5, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following plants belong to family Solanaceae?
Petunia, Tomato, Potato, Withania (Ashwagandha), Wheat, Brinjal, Indigofera
questions.explanation: Solanaceae: Petunia, Tomato, Potato, Withania, Brinjal = 5. Wheat (Poaceae) and Indigofera (Fabaceae) are not. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 5, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following enzymes are present in pancreatic juice?
Trypsinogen, Lipase, Pepsinogen, Amylase, Nucleases, Procarboxypeptidase, Rennin
questions.explanation: Pancreatic: Trypsinogen, Lipase, Amylase, Nucleases, Procarboxypeptidase = 5. Pepsinogen and Rennin are gastric. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 16, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following are types of White Blood Cells (leucocytes)?
Neutrophils, Thrombocytes, Eosinophils, Basophils, Lymphocytes, Erythrocytes, Monocytes
questions.explanation: WBC types: Neutrophils, Eosinophils, Basophils, Lymphocytes, Monocytes = 5. Thrombocytes (platelets) and Erythrocytes (RBCs) are not WBCs. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 18, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following are cranial nerves?
Optic, Vagus, Sciatic, Trigeminal, Facial, Phrenic, Abducens, Auditory (Vestibulocochlear)
questions.explanation: Cranial nerves: Optic (II), Vagus (X), Trigeminal (V), Facial (VII), Abducens (VI), Auditory (VIII) = 6. Sciatic and Phrenic are spinal nerves. Count = 6. NCERT Ch 21, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following hormones are secreted by the anterior pituitary gland?
Growth Hormone (GH), Oxytocin, Prolactin (PRL), TSH, ADH (Vasopressin), ACTH, LH, FSH
questions.explanation: Anterior pituitary hormones: GH, PRL, TSH, ACTH, LH, FSH = 6. Oxytocin and ADH are from posterior pituitary. Count = 6. NCERT Ch 22, Class 11.

questions.question:
How many of the following codons are stop codons (termination codons)?
AUG, UAA, UAG, UGA, AUU, GUA, UUU
questions.explanation: Stop codons: UAA (Ochre), UAG (Amber), UGA (Opal) = 3. AUG is start codon. AUU, GUA, UUU code for amino acids. Count = 3. NCERT Ch 6, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are salient features of the genetic code?
(i) Triplet in nature
(ii) Degenerate
(iii) Overlapping
(iv) Universal
(v) Unambiguous
(vi) Commaless
questions.explanation: (i) Triplet — Yes. (ii) Degenerate — Yes. (iii) Overlapping — No (non-overlapping). (iv) Universal — Yes. (v) Unambiguous — Yes. (vi) Commaless — Yes. Count = 5 (i, ii, iv, v, vi). NCERT Ch 6, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are required for DNA replication?
(i) DNA polymerase
(ii) Helicase
(iii) DNA ligase
(iv) Primase
(v) Deoxyribonucleoside triphosphates
(vi) RNA polymerase
(vii) Reverse transcriptase
questions.explanation: Required for replication: (i) DNA polymerase — Yes. (ii) Helicase — Yes. (iii) DNA ligase — Yes. (iv) Primase — Yes. (v) dNTPs — Yes. (vi) RNA polymerase — No (transcription). (vii) Reverse transcriptase — No (retroviruses). Count = 5. NCERT Ch 6, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are components of a nucleotide?
(i) Nitrogenous base
(ii) Pentose sugar
(iii) Phosphate group
(iv) Amino acid
(v) Glycerol
(vi) Fatty acid
questions.explanation: Nucleotide components: (i) Nitrogenous base — Yes. (ii) Pentose sugar — Yes. (iii) Phosphate group — Yes. Others are components of proteins/lipids. Count = 3. NCERT Ch 6, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are autosomal recessive genetic disorders?
Sickle cell anaemia, Haemophilia, Phenylketonuria, Thalassemia, Colour blindness, Cystic fibrosis, Down syndrome
questions.explanation: Autosomal recessive: Sickle cell anaemia, Phenylketonuria, Thalassemia, Cystic fibrosis = 4. Haemophilia and Colour blindness are X-linked recessive. Down syndrome is chromosomal (trisomy 21). Count = 4. NCERT Ch 5, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are chromosomal disorders?
Down syndrome, Turner syndrome, Klinefelter syndrome, Sickle cell anaemia, Haemophilia, Cri du chat syndrome
questions.explanation: Chromosomal disorders: Down syndrome (trisomy 21), Turner syndrome (45,X), Klinefelter syndrome (47,XXY), Cri du chat syndrome (chromosome 5 deletion) = 4. Sickle cell anaemia and Haemophilia are gene/Mendelian disorders. Count = 4. NCERT Ch 5, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following show co-dominance as a pattern of inheritance?
ABO blood groups (AB type), Sickle cell trait (HbAS), Flower colour in snapdragon, Height in humans, Skin colour in humans, Coat colour in cattle (roan)
questions.explanation: Co-dominance: ABO blood groups AB type (IA and IB both expressed) and Sickle cell trait HbAS (both HbA and HbS produced) = 2. Snapdragon = incomplete dominance. Height/skin colour = polygenic. Count = 2. NCERT Ch 5, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following hormones play a role in regulating spermatogenesis?
GnRH, LH, FSH, Testosterone, Estrogen, Progesterone, Inhibin
questions.explanation: Spermatogenesis hormones: GnRH, LH, FSH, Testosterone, Inhibin = 5. Estrogen and Progesterone are primarily female hormones. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 3, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are extraembryonic membranes in human development?
Amnion, Chorion, Allantois, Yolk sac, Placenta, Umbilical cord
questions.explanation: Extraembryonic membranes: Amnion, Chorion, Allantois, Yolk sac = 4. Placenta is an organ, not a membrane. Umbilical cord is a structure. Count = 4. NCERT Ch 3, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are accessory glands of the male reproductive system?
Seminal vesicles, Prostate gland, Bulbourethral glands (Cowper's glands), Bartholin's glands, Epididymis, Vas deferens
questions.explanation: Male accessory glands: Seminal vesicles, Prostate gland, Bulbourethral/Cowper's glands = 3. Bartholin's glands are female. Epididymis and Vas deferens are ducts, not glands. Count = 3. NCERT Ch 3, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are tools of recombinant DNA technology?
(i) Restriction endonucleases
(ii) DNA ligase
(iii) Vectors
(iv) Host organism
(v) Gel electrophoresis
(vi) PCR
(vii) Ribosome
questions.explanation: rDNA tools: (i) Restriction endonucleases — Yes. (ii) DNA ligase — Yes. (iii) Vectors — Yes. (iv) Host organism — Yes. (v) Gel electrophoresis — Yes. (vi) PCR — Yes. (vii) Ribosome — No. Count = 6. NCERT Ch 11, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are applications of biotechnology in agriculture?
Bt cotton, Golden rice, Flavr Savr tomato, Rosie (transgenic cow), Dolly (cloned sheep), Pest-resistant crops, Cry proteins in crops
questions.explanation: Agricultural applications: Bt cotton, Golden rice, Flavr Savr tomato, Pest-resistant crops, Cry proteins in crops = 5. Rosie (medical) and Dolly (cloning) are not agricultural. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 12, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following can be used as cloning vectors in recombinant DNA technology?
Plasmids, Bacteriophages, Cosmids, Ribosomes, BAC (Bacterial Artificial Chromosomes), Lysosomes
questions.explanation: Cloning vectors: Plasmids (e.g., pBR322), Bacteriophages, Cosmids, BAC = 4. Ribosomes and Lysosomes are organelles, not vectors. Count = 4. NCERT Ch 11, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are vestigial organs in humans?
Vermiform appendix, Nictitating membrane, Coccyx (tail bone), Wisdom teeth, Ear muscles (auricular muscles), Thyroid gland
questions.explanation: Vestigial: Vermiform appendix, Nictitating membrane, Coccyx, Wisdom teeth, Ear muscles = 5. Thyroid gland is fully functional. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 7, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are examples of analogous organs?
(i) Wings of butterfly and wings of bird
(ii) Flippers of whale and forelimbs of horse
(iii) Eyes of octopus and eyes of mammals
(iv) Wings of bat and wings of bird
(v) Thorns of Bougainvillea and tendrils of Cucurbita
(vi) Sweet potato and potato
questions.explanation: Analogous: (i) Butterfly wings and bird wings — Yes. (iii) Octopus eyes and mammal eyes — Yes. (vi) Sweet potato (root) and potato (stem) — Yes. (ii), (iv), (v) are homologous. Count = 3. NCERT Ch 7, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are evidences supporting organic evolution?
(i) Fossil records
(ii) Comparative anatomy
(iii) Embryology
(iv) Molecular biology
(v) Biogeography
(vi) Artificial selection
questions.explanation: All six are evidences: Fossils, Comparative anatomy, Embryology, Molecular biology, Biogeography, Artificial selection = 6. Count = 6. NCERT Ch 7, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are abiotic components of an ecosystem?
Temperature, Soil, Bacteria, Water, Light, Humidity, Fungi
questions.explanation: Abiotic: Temperature, Soil, Water, Light, Humidity = 5. Bacteria and Fungi are biotic (living). Count = 5. NCERT Ch 14, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are gaseous biogeochemical cycles?
Carbon cycle, Nitrogen cycle, Phosphorus cycle, Water cycle, Sulphur cycle, Oxygen cycle
questions.explanation: Gaseous cycles: Carbon (CO2 in atmosphere), Nitrogen (N2 in atmosphere), Water (hydrological), Oxygen (O2 in atmosphere) = 4. Phosphorus (sedimentary) and Sulphur (primarily sedimentary) are not gaseous. Count = 4. NCERT Ch 14, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following ecological pyramids can be inverted?
(i) Pyramid of number in grassland
(ii) Pyramid of number in a tree ecosystem
(iii) Pyramid of biomass in a forest
(iv) Pyramid of biomass in an ocean
(v) Pyramid of energy in any ecosystem
(vi) Pyramid of number in a pond
questions.explanation: Can be inverted: (ii) Tree ecosystem number pyramid — Yes (inverted). (iv) Ocean biomass pyramid — Yes (inverted, phytoplankton biomass < zooplankton). Others are upright. Energy pyramid is never inverted. Count = 2. NCERT Ch 14, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are present in a mature embryo sac of angiosperms?
(i) Egg cell
(ii) Two synergid cells
(iii) Three antipodal cells
(iv) Two polar nuclei in central cell
(v) Two generative cells
(vi) Tube cell
questions.explanation: In embryo sac: (i) Egg cell — Yes. (ii) Synergids — Yes. (iii) Antipodals — Yes. (iv) Polar nuclei — Yes. (v) Generative cells — No (pollen grain). (vi) Tube cell — No (pollen grain). Count = 4. NCERT Ch 2, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following plants are pollinated by wind (anemophily)?
Corn (maize), Rose, Grass, Wheat, Jasmine, Cannabis, Rice
questions.explanation: Wind-pollinated: Corn, Grass, Wheat, Cannabis, Rice = 5. Insect-pollinated: Rose (showy), Jasmine (fragrant). Count = 5. NCERT Ch 2, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are outbreeding devices in angiosperms?
(i) Dichogamy
(ii) Self-incompatibility
(iii) Unisexual flowers
(iv) Cleistogamy
(v) Herkogamy
(vi) Dioecious condition
questions.explanation: Outbreeding devices: (i) Dichogamy — Yes. (ii) Self-incompatibility — Yes. (iii) Unisexual flowers — Yes. (iv) Cleistogamy — No (promotes self-pollination). (v) Herkogamy — Yes. (vi) Dioecious — Yes. Count = 5. NCERT Ch 2, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following diseases are caused by protozoans?
Malaria, Amoebiasis, Typhoid, Sleeping sickness, Filariasis, Leishmaniasis (Kala-azar), Ascariasis
questions.explanation: Protozoan diseases: Malaria (Plasmodium), Amoebiasis (Entamoeba), Sleeping sickness (Trypanosoma), Leishmaniasis (Leishmania) = 4. Typhoid (bacterial), Filariasis (helminth), Ascariasis (helminth). Count = 4. NCERT Ch 8, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs)?
AIDS, Gonorrhoea, Syphilis, Typhoid, Genital herpes, Hepatitis-B, Chlamydiasis, Malaria
questions.explanation: STIs: AIDS, Gonorrhoea, Syphilis, Genital herpes, Hepatitis-B, Chlamydiasis = 6. Typhoid (fecal-oral) and Malaria (mosquito-borne) are not STIs. Count = 6. NCERT Ch 3 and 8, Class 12.

questions.question:
How many of the following are bacterial diseases?
Tuberculosis, Plague, Ringworm, Cholera, Typhoid, Malaria, Diphtheria, Common cold
questions.explanation: Bacterial: Tuberculosis (Mycobacterium), Plague (Yersinia), Cholera (Vibrio), Typhoid (Salmonella), Diphtheria (Corynebacterium) = 5. Ringworm (fungal), Malaria (protozoan), Common cold (viral). Count = 5. NCERT Ch 8, Class 12.
